title: Homework 3
text:
Read in dataset

load("hw2_list.rda")

Create objects

t_df <- bp_list$treatment
p_df <- bp_list$placebo




Add new status column to both data frames within the bp_list


bp_list$treatment$status <- character(20) 


bp_list$placebo$status <- character(10) 


Add values to new ‘status’ columns


t_df$status <- ifelse(t_df$post_bp <= 120,"Optimal",
                               ifelse(t_df$post_bp>120 & t_df$post_bp <=130, "Borderline",
                                      ifelse(t_df$post_bp>130, "High",NA)))


p_df$status <- ifelse(p_df$post_bp <= 120,"Optimal",
                               ifelse(p_df$post_bp>120 & p_df$post_bp <=130, "Borderline",
                                      ifelse(p_df$post_bp>130, "High",NA)))




1.Create a function a. takes in a list with two data frames in it (a treatment and a placebo data frame) as an argument.

sum_stat <- function(data_list) {
  treatment <- data_list$treatment
  placebo <- data_list$placebo
}


takes in an R function (that would find a summary of a numeric column) with the default value being set to “mean” (notice this is a quoted string).


sum_stat <- function(data_list, stat = "mean") {
  treatment <- data_list$treatment
  placebo <- data_list$placebo
}


Finds the statistic of interest (as defined by the user input) for the pre, post, and diff columns of both data frames. – Use my_fun <- get(stat) within the function to get the function from the quoted string.


sum_stat <- function(data_list, stat = "mean") {
  treatment <- data_list$treatment
  placebo <- data_list$placebo
my_fun <- get(stat)
  treatment_pre <- my_fun(treatment$pre)
  treatment_post <- my_fun(treatment$post)
  treatment_diff <- my_fun(treatment$diff)
  
  placebo_pre <- my_fun(placebo$pre)
  placebo_post <- my_fun(placebo$post)
  placebo_diff <- my_fun(placebo$diff)
}


These six values should then be returned as a named list with meaningful names - this is a somewhat challenging part!


sum_stat <- function(data_list, stat = "mean") {
  treatment <- data_list$treatment
  placebo <- data_list$placebo
my_fun <- get(stat)
  treatment_pre <- my_fun(treatment$pre)
  treatment_post <- my_fun(treatment$post)
  treatment_diff <- my_fun(treatment$diff)
  
  placebo_pre <- my_fun(placebo$pre)
  placebo_post <- my_fun(placebo$post)
  placebo_diff <- my_fun(placebo$diff)
  
  values <- c(treatment_pre, treatment_post, treatment_diff, placebo_pre, placebo_post, placebo_diff)
  
  names(values) <- c(paste0("treatment_", c("pre_", "post_", "diff_"), stat),
                     paste0("placebo_", c("pre_", "post_", "diff_"), stat))
  
    return(values)
}


Finally, apply your function to you list of data frames from previous. Use it without specifying your statistic, with specifying your statistic as “var”, “sd”, “min”, and “max”.


sum_stat(bp_list)

 treatment_pre_mean treatment_post_mean treatment_diff_mean    placebo_pre_mean 
             131.60              125.95                5.65              131.90 
  placebo_post_mean   placebo_diff_mean 
             128.90                3.00 



sum_stat(bp_list, stat = "var")

 treatment_pre_var treatment_post_var treatment_diff_var    placebo_pre_var 
          75.72632           78.99737          117.81842          149.87778 
  placebo_post_var   placebo_diff_var 
         124.98889          341.33333 



sum_stat(bp_list, stat = "sd")

 treatment_pre_sd treatment_post_sd treatment_diff_sd    placebo_pre_sd 
         8.702087          8.888046         10.854419         12.242458 
  placebo_post_sd   placebo_diff_sd 
        11.179843         18.475209 



sum_stat(bp_list, stat = "min")

 treatment_pre_min treatment_post_min treatment_diff_min    placebo_pre_min 
               115                114                -24                114 
  placebo_post_min   placebo_diff_min 
               105                -21 



sum_stat(bp_list, stat = "max")

 treatment_pre_max treatment_post_max treatment_diff_max    placebo_pre_max 
               151                146                 21                152 
  placebo_post_max   placebo_diff_max 
               143                 33

title: Homework 3
text:
Add new status column to both data frames within the bp_list


bp_list$treatment$status <- character(20) 


bp_list$placebo$status <- character(10) 


Add values to new ‘status’ columns


t_df$status <- ifelse(t_df$post_bp <= 120,"Optimal",
                               ifelse(t_df$post_bp>120 & t_df$post_bp <=130, "Borderline",
                                      ifelse(t_df$post_bp>130, "High",NA)))


p_df$status <- ifelse(p_df$post_bp <= 120,"Optimal",
                               ifelse(p_df$post_bp>120 & p_df$post_bp <=130, "Borderline",
                                      ifelse(p_df$post_bp>130, "High",NA)))

title: Homework 3

  placebo <- data_list$placebo
